import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import os

# reading csv dataset file
plant1_gen = pd.read_csv('../input/solar-power-generation-data/Plant_1_Generation_Data.csv')
plant1_gen.name = 'Plant 1 Generation'
plant1_weth = pd.read_csv('../input/solar-power-generation-data/Plant_1_Weather_Sensor_Data.csv')
plant1_weth.name = 'Plant 1 weather sensor'
plant2_gen = pd.read_csv('../input/solar-power-generation-data/Plant_2_Generation_Data.csv')
plant2_gen.name = 'Plant 2 generation'
plant2_weth = pd.read_csv('../input/solar-power-generation-data/Plant_2_Weather_Sensor_Data.csv')
plant2_weth.name = 'Plant 2 weather sensor'

plant_gen = [plant1_gen,plant2_gen]
plant_weth = [plant1_weth,plant2_weth]
source.54388ce0:
for plant in plant_gen:
    print("The mean value of daily yield in {} is {}".format(plant.name,plant['DAILY_YIELD'].mean()))
source.23efecce:
for plant in plant_weth:
    plant1_weth['DATES'] = pd.to_datetime(plant1_weth['DATE_TIME']).dt.date
    gruped = plant1_weth.groupby('DATES')
    print("The total irradiation per day for {} is \n {} \n".format(plant.name,gruped['IRRADIATION'].sum()))
source.42aa2fa1:
for plant in plant_weth:
    max_ambtemp = plant['AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE'].max()
    max_modtemp = plant['MODULE_TEMPERATURE'].max()
    min_ambtemp = plant['AMBIENT_TEMPERATURE'].min()
    min_modtemp = plant['MODULE_TEMPERATURE'].min()
    print("The maximum ambient and module temperature of {} are {} and {} respectively.".format(plant.name,max_ambtemp,max_modtemp))
    print("The minimum ambient and module temperature of {} are {} and {} respectively.".format(plant.name,min_ambtemp,min_modtemp))
source.12fa8cfb: # 4.How many inverters are there for each plant?
source.77a3c044:
The dataset uesd in this project is obtained from a solar power plant. Today, solar power plant is a major alternate source for electricity. As we have abundant amount of sunlight available solar power plants can produce huge amount of electricity(based on the capability of the solar cell). Nowadays many people are building solar plants on their lands and are selling electricity for money.

So data science plays a major role in improving the generation of electricity as well as the sales of these produced current. In this data set we are provided with datas of 2 solar plants. These plants have 22 inverters and every 15 minutes datas from these inverters are collected. The datas obtained are the daily production of electriciy(DAILY_YIELD),total production of electricity(TOTAL_YIELD),the DC current produced by the solar cell(DC_POWER) and the AC current converted by the inverters(AC_POWER) along with that other datas like invertor id(SOURCE_KEY),plant id(PLANT_ID),date and time(DATE_TIME) are also given.

Using these datas we can predict: 

The cause of low generation of electricity
The amount of electricity produced in later days
Price of the solar cell(for manufacturers)
Wether a place is suitable for solar plant,etc


Some of the insights from the dataset are given below:
